before.enText: of problems or a difficult situation

data.enText: to appear and need to be dealt with by sb

data.chText: 这个国家所面临的经济问题
data.enText: the economic problems confronting the country

data.chText: 政府发现自己遭到了强烈的反对。
data.enText: The government found itself confronted by massive opposition.
to deal with a problem or difficult situation

data.chText: 她心里明白自己必须克服恐惧心理。
data.enText: She knew that she had to confront her fears.
to face sb so that they cannot avoid seeing and hearing you, especially in an unfriendly or dangerous situation

data.chText: 这是他第一次面对一个武装劫匪。
data.enText: This was the first time he had confronted an armed robber.

data.chText: 使面对，使面临，使对付（令人不快或难处的人、场合）
data.enText: to make sb face or deal with an unpleasant or difficult person or situation

data.chText: 他要她在事业和他们两人关系之间作出抉择。
data.enText: He confronted her with a choice between her career or their relationship.
to have sth in front of you that you have to deal with or react to

data.chText: 大多数人遇见马时都会轻轻地拍拍它。
data.enText: Most people when confronted with a horse will pat it.

simple_means.memory_skill: con 共同 + front 前额 →〔与敌人〕面对面 → 面临；对抗

ex.chText: 猜猜我在购物中心遇到谁了？
ex.enText: Guess who I met in the shopping mall?

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指偶然相遇或在事先约好的地方与某人见面，不用被动语态。

ex.chText: 她在城里遇见了前男友。
ex.enText: She bumped into her ex-boyfriend in town.

synonyms.bx: 指意外地遇见相识的人。

ex.chText: 她在上学的路上偶然遇见了他。
ex.enText: She came across him on her way to school.

ex.chText: 他在她的抽屉里偶然发现了一枚戒指。
ex.enText: He came across a ring in her drawer.

synonyms.bx: 指偶然遇见或发现某人或某物。

ex.chText: 该组织面临的阻碍是巨大的。
ex.enText: The obstacles confronting the organization are enormous.

synonyms.bx: 通常指遇到问题、困境等。

ex.chText: 新来的经理在第一周遇到了一些困难。
ex.enText: The new manager encountered some difficulties in his first week.

ex.chText: 董事会的裁员计划遭到了强烈的反对。
ex.enText: The board has encountered strong opposition to its plan to reduce employees.

ex.chText: 你第一次遇到他是在什么时候？
ex.enText: When did you first encounter him?

synonyms.bx: 尤指遇到困难、问题或他人的反对，也指偶遇某人。

ex.chText: 他正面临一项艰巨的任务。
ex.enText: He is facing a difficult task.

ex.chText: 吵架之后，她不知该如何面对他。
ex.enText: She didn't know how to face him after their quarrel.

synonyms.bx: 指面临必须处理的困难局面，或指与某人交往，而这种交往通常令人不快或难以应对。

ex.enText: I ran/came across him in the cafeteria.

ex.chText: 她在清理抽屉的时候发现了一本旧日记。
ex.enText: She ran/came across an old diary while clearing out her drawer.

synonyms.bx: 词义同 come across，常可换用。

ex.chText: 他因讲了个下流笑话而受到批评。
ex.enText: He ran into criticism after he had told a dirty joke.

ex.chText: 他的公司陷入了经济困境。
ex.enText: His company ran into financial difficulties.

ex.chText: 猜猜今天早上我碰见了谁！
ex.enText: Guess who I ran into this morning!

synonyms.bx: 指遇到困难或不利局势，也可指偶然碰见某人。

example: He faced the terrible consequences of his mistakes

tr: present somebody with something, usually to accuse or criticize
example: We confronted him with the evidence
He was faced with all the evidence and could no longer deny his actions

tr: oppose, as in hostility or a competition
example: Jackson faced Smith in the boxing ring
The two enemies finally confronted each other
The child screamed when he confronted the man in the Halloween costume

value.def: If you are confronted with a problem, task, or difficulty, you have to deal with it.

example.ex: She was confronted with severe money problems...
example.tran: 她面临严峻的资金问题。

example.ex: Ministers underestimated the magnitude of the task confronting them.
example.tran: 部长们低估了他们所面临的任务的艰巨性。

value.tran: (问题、任务或困难)降临，使面临

value.def: If you confront a difficult situation or issue, you accept the fact that it exists and try to deal with it.

example.ex: We are learning how to confront death...
example.tran: 我们正在学习如何直面死亡。

example.ex: NATO countries have been forced to confront fundamental moral questions.
example.tran: 北约国家被迫正视基本的道德问题。

value.def: If you are confronted by something that you find threatening or difficult to deal with, it is there in front of you.

example.ex: I was confronted with an array of knobs, levers, and switches.
example.tran: 我面对的是一大堆旋钮、控制杆和开关。

value.tran: 使面对(有威胁性或困难的事)

value.def: If you confront someone, you stand or sit in front of them, especially when you are going to fight, argue, or compete with them.

example.ex: She pushed her way through the mob and confronted him face to face...
example.tran: 她挤过骚动的人群，与他当面对峙。

example.ex: They don't hesitate to open fire when confronted by police...
example.tran: 他们遭遇警察时毫不犹豫地开火。

example.ex: The candidates confronted each other during a televised debate.
example.tran: 候选人在电视辩论中当面交锋。

value.def: If you confront someone with something, you present facts or evidence to them in order to accuse them of something.

example.ex: She had decided to confront Kathryn with what she had learnt...
example.tran: 她决定拿自己了解的事实与凯瑟琳当面对证。

example.ex: I could not bring myself to confront him about it...
example.tran: 我不忍心就这事和他对质。

example.ex: His confronting me forced me to search for the answers.
example.tran: 他对我的当面质询迫使我思索如何作答。

partsOfSpeech.dec: af 加强 + front 前额 → 一再指〔别人的〕额头 → 冒犯
con 共同 + front 前额 →〔与敌人〕面对面 → 面临；对抗
ef〔= e 出〕+ front 前额 + ery 表行为 → 厚颜无耻
fore 前面 + front 前额 → 前面的前面 → 最前部
front 前额 + al …的 → 正面的；前额的
com 共同 + par 平等 + ison → 平等地放在一起 → 比较
com 共同 + passion 感情 → 有共同感情 → 同情
com 共同 + patri 父亲 + ot 表人 → 同一个父亲 → 同胞
com 共同 + pon 放 + ent 人或物 → 放到一起〔组成其他事物的东西〕→ 成分
con 共同 + centric 中心的 → 同中心的
con 共同 + cord 心 → 同心协力 → 和睦
con 共同 + cur 跑，引申为发生 → 同时发生
con 共同 + flict 打 → 两边打斗 → 冲突
con 共同 + flu 流 + ence 表行为 → 流到一起 → 汇流
con 共同 + front 面 → 面对
con 共同 + nect 连接 → 连接；联合
con 共同 + sist 站 → 站在一起 → 一致
con 共同 + son 声音 + ant …的 → 共同的声音 → 一致的
con 共同 + spir 呼吸 + e → 沆瀣一气 → 同谋
con 共同 + tempor 时间 + ary …的 → 同时代的
cor 共同 + relate 联系 → 共同联系 → 相互关联
cor 共同 + respond 反应 → 相互反应 → 通信
com 表加强 + bat 打，击 → 打得非常激烈 → 格斗
com 表加强 + fort 强壮的 → 使〔精神〕强大 → 安慰
com 表加强 + memor 记忆 + ate 做，造成，使… → 纪念
com 表加强 + ment 思考，神智 → 努力把自己的思考〔表达出来〕→ 评论
com 表加强 + mot 动 + ion 表状态 → 到处都在动 → 动乱
com 表加强 + pact 合同 → 合同
com 表加强 + pel 驱动，推 → 一再推 → 强迫
com 表加强 + pet 追求 + e → 一再追求，永无止境 → 比赛
com 表加强 + plac 使满意 + ent 具有…性质的 → 对〔自己〕非常满意 → 自满的
com 表加强 + plet 满 + e → 全部满了 → 完成
com 表加强 + prehend 抓住 → 牢牢抓住 → 理解
com 表加强 + press 压 → 一再压 → 压缩
con 表加强 + cept 拿，握住 → 牢牢拿住 → 概念
con 表加强 + cis 切 + e → 切掉〔多余的〕→ 简洁的
con 表加强 + clud 关闭 + e → 关掉 → 结束
con 表加强 + dense 密集的 → 使变密集 → 凝结；浓缩
con 表加强 + duct 引导 → 管理；引导
con 表加强 + fid 相信 + ant 表人 → 让人信任的人 → 知己
con 表加强 + firm 坚定 → 非常肯定 → 证实
con 表加强 + greg 集合 + ate 做，造成，使… → 集合到一起 → 聚集
cor 表加强 + rect 正 → 一再改正 → 纠正
cor 表加强 + robor 力量 + ate 使… → 使更有力 → 使坚固
cor 表加强 + ros 咬 + ion 表动作 → 不断咬 → 腐蚀
cor 表加强 + rupt 断 →〔道德〕彻底断裂 → 腐败的
